feed.title: O'Reilly News: XML
feed.subtitle: XML news and articles from O'Reilly Media

entry.title: Groklaw is on-message
entry.summary: Waiting on this wintery Sydney day for my flatmate's Chinese roast pork knuckle with bamboo to cook, I thought I'd check up on a suspicion that had formed in my mind: had Growlaw ever published anything on OOXML/ODF recently that was not just Big Blue's message of the week?
entry.content: Waiting on this wintery Sydney day for my flatmate's Chinese roast pork knuckle with bamboo to cook, I thought I'd check up on a suspicion that had formed in my mind: had Growlaw ever published anything on OOXML/ODF recently that was not just Big Blue's message of the week?

entry.title: Open Standards are no silver bullet
entry.summary: A new academic paper looking at running code and open standard says "A running code requirement would have led Massachusetts to defer adopting ODF"
entry.content: A new academic paper looking at running code and open standard says "A running code requirement would have led Massachusetts to defer adopting ODF"

entry.title: The conspiracy to save ODF from being so crappy
entry.summary: To see Alex and my comments as part of some denial of service attack on ODF is laughable; indeed to see the volume of what we write as a sign that there must be some large team behind us (or even that we are in some way co-ordinated) is I suppose something we should take as a compliment.
entry.content: To see Alex and my comments as part of some denial of service attack on ODF is laughable; indeed to see the volume of what we write as a sign that there must be some large team behind us (or even that we are in some way co-ordinated) is I suppose something we should take as a compliment.
